comments.body: should probably have `choices` specified if possible
I think right now the only value is "Standard", maybe something else will be introduced in the future.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +81,85 @@                type: int
    database_account_offer_type:
        description:
            - Database account offer type, for example I(Standard)
            - Required when C(state) is I(present).

@@ -1,1 +88,92 @@            - "Cosmos DB Firewall Support: This value specifies the set of IP addresses or IP address ranges in CIDR form to be included as the allowed list
               of client IPs for a given database account. IP addresses/ranges must be comma separated and must not contain any spaces."
    is_virtual_network_filter_enabled:
        description:
            - Flag to indicate whether to enable/disable Virtual Network ACL rules.

comments.body: I'm loathe to add another layer of depth to this, but should we consider having this follow the same patterns the other modules are now with taking either a flat ID or a name + optional RG name?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +115,119 @@        suboptions:
            subnet:
                description:
                    - It can be a string containing resource if of a subnet.
                    - It can be a dictionary containing 'resource_group', 'virtual_network_name' and 'subnet_name'

@@ -1,1 +124,128 @@
    enable_multiple_write_locations:
        description:
            - Enables the account to write in multiple locations
        type: bool
